title: Introducing yourself
description: Tell others about your name, nationality, and condition.

lesson.instruction: This is how you would refer to yourself.
When describing yourself in the present tense, use ni.
Type your name into the blank. This is one way to tell someone your name.
This is how you would refer to a single person you are talking to.
How do you think you would say this?
The Swahili word for "nice" is the same as the word for "good".
How would you tell someone you are an American?
This is the formal way to say "no". You may also hear a Swahili speaker say la instead of hapana.
The word si is the opposite of ni - you often hear this sound when talking about something in the negative.
Tell someone that you are not from Tanzania.
This is how you would refer to any African person.

lesson.english: I am American and you are Kenyan.
I am good, how about you?

lesson.instruction: The word lakini is a common conjunction between contrasting statements.
lesson.english: I am not Tanzanian, but I am African.
